deck: John Constantine struggles to find out what happened to Zatanna and the rest of his teammates after Pandora's box was opened, while rallying the Earth's mystic heroes against a deadly entity called Blight, the physical manifestation of all evil in the universe.
description:
Overview

Forever Evil: Blight is a crossover within the larger story of Forever Evil, between the four titles Justice League Dark, Trinity of Sin: The Phantom Stranger, Trinity of Sin: Pandora and Constantine. It sees John Constantine assemble his remaining "allies" in an attempt to rescue his Justice League Dark teammates, while fighting off the physical manifestation of evil known as Blight.

Reading Order

  1. JUSTICE LEAGUE DARK #24
  2. JUSTICE LEAGUE DARK #25
  3. TRINITY OF SIN: THE PHANTOM STRANGER #14
  4. CONSTANTINE #9

deck: The main story arc of the 2nd series of the rebooted Doctor Who
description:
Over the series the word "Torchwood" apperaed many times. Torchwood was created to monitor The Doctor ever since The Doctor encountered Queen Victoria in 1879. The word appeared in the following episodes ...

#112 Bad Wolf - When Rose was playing the weakest link one of the answers was 'Torchwood'

#200 Christmas Invasion - The organisation that was monitoring the situation was 'Torchwood'

#202 Tooth and Claw - The Doctor meets Queen Victoria and the Queen creates Torchwood

#203 School Reunion - Mickey is looking up infromation on apparent UFO sightings but information is being blocked by torchwood.

#205 Rise of the Cybermen - Torchwood is mentioned by Pete

#207 The Idiots Lantern - Torchwood is mentioned by a police officer

#209 The Satan Pit - Zack mentions that the expodetion is part of the Torchwood archive.

#210 Love & Monsters - Kennedy mentions that the Bad Wolf virus affected the Torchwood files on the Doctor.

in #212 Army of Ghosts ans #213 Doomsday all is revealed about Torchwood.
name: Torchwood

deck: Dealing with the aftermath of the "Infinity" event when the Terrigen Mists are released throughout the world and activate dormant "Inhuman" cells in ordinary people.
description:
Description

Inhumanity is a Marvel event stretching from December 2013 to March 2014, dealing with the aftermath of the Infinity event when the Terrigen Mists are released throughout the world and activate dormant Inhuman cells in ordinary people.

The core title and new ongoing series is Inhuman; written by Matt Fraction and illustrated by Joe Madureira.

Core Series

  • Inhuman; written by Matt Fraction and illustrated by Joe Madureira; January 2014.

Tie-ins

  • Avengers A.I. #7.INH; written by Sam Humphries and illustrated by Andr Lima Arajo; December 2013.
  • Avengers Assemble #21.INH-#25.INH; written by Kelly Sue DeConnick and Warren Ellis and illustrated by Matteo Buffagni; November 2013 - March 2014.
  • Indestructible Hulk #17.INH-#18.INH; written by Mark Waid and illustrated by Clay Mann and Miguel Sepulveda; December 2013 - January 2014.
  • Iron Man #20.INH; written by Kieron Gillen and illustrated by Agustin Padilla; January 2014.
  • Mighty Avengers #4.INH; written by Al Ewing and illustrated by Greg Land; December 2013.
  • New Avengers #13.INH; written by Jonathan Hickman and illustrated by Simone Bianchi; December 2013.
  • Uncanny X-Men #15.INH; written by Brian Michael Bendis and illustrated by Kris Anka; December 2013.

Limited Series

  • Inhumanity #1-2; written by Matt Fraction and illustrated by Nick Bradshaw and Olivier Coipel; December 2013.
  • Inhumanity: The Awakening #1-2; written by Matt Kindt and illustrated by Paul Davidson; December 2013.

One-Shots

  • Inhumanity: Spider-Man #1; written by Christos Gage and illustrated by Stephanie Hans; January 2014.

Plot Summary

tbd

Collected Editions

  • Avengers Assemble: The Forgeries of Jealousy
  • Inhumanity
  • Indestructible Hulk: Humanity Bomb

deck: Ultimate Comics event that follows the events from Hunger. The story involves Galactus and the Heroes of Ultimate Earth (1610).
description:
As a result of "Age of Ultron" Earth 616's Galactus found his way into the 1610 (Ultimate) Universe. The events were told in Hunger, which showed his merger with the Gah Lak Tus of the Ultimate Universe and his battles with Silver Surfer, Rick Jones, Captain Marvel and others. Cataclysm continues Galactus' conflict with the Ultimate Universe Earth's Heroes (Ultimates, Spider-Man, & Ultimate X-Men).

Related Issues

  • Hunger #1
  • Hunger #2
  • Hunger #3
  • Hunger #4

aliases: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
deck: Deadpool, Wolverine and Captain America all have to face a haunting part of Deadpool's past.
description:
Quick Summary

Deadpool meets with Wolverine and Captain America begging them for help because he suspects someone is targeting Weapons Plus alumni. They say no to Deadpool who then gets caught by a man named Butler. Deadpool the breaks out and meets a "fake" version of the X-Men grown using his regeneration and parts of the X-Men. He also finds out his daughter and his daughter's mother Carmelita are trapped by Butler along with Wolverine and Captain America. With the help of the "fake" X-Men, the real Wolverine and Captain America they take over the camp and Deadpool finds out Camrelita is dead. His child is expected dead. Deadpool kills Butler and blows up the camp, Wolverine and Captain America leave North Korea with Deadpool.
